Issues.Title: Angular update guide does not have instructions for how to actually update via CLI
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

The [Angular Update Guide](https://update.angular.io/?v=15.0-16.0) no longer/does not provide any instructions for a CLI command, such as `ng update`, to update between versions. 

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://update.angular.io/?v=15.0-16.0

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

The page currently says, "Review these changes and perform the actions to update your application." All of the listed items are things that someone will need to change in their repo either before or after updating. There are no instructions to actually update Angular from one version to another. If `ng update` is all that is needed, I think that would be good to show -- I found it very confusing to not see any actual commands to run.

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

I wanted to update from V15 to V16 and wanted to very carefully follow update instructions, including command line commands.

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

I would like to be able to see a command line function that tells me exactly what to type to update from v15 to v16. From a UX perspective, I would also suggest removing the "Show me how to update" button after the instructions are displayed, and reinstating it if changes are made to the form above. Because I didn't understand the text below the form as "how to update", I kept pressing this assuming it would possibly open a new tab/modal, or somehow show the information I expected, and my impression was that it was broken. 

### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

_No response_

### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here

_No response_

### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version

_No response_

### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can

_No response_

Issues.Title: Provide pipe for async signal or enable asyncComputed
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Currently when doing async computation on a signal with a `| async`, the last value of the signal is erased: 
See: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4d9tdo?file=src%2Fmain.ts,src%2Findex.html 

On the above example, when clicking on the button, the `lateCount` value disappears until promise resolves, which leads to poor UX.

### Proposed solution

There is two solutions : 
- Provide some kind of `asyncComputed` that would keep previous value until Promise resolves with a different value.
- Provide a new pipe that would display last value until the Promise resolves.

### Alternatives considered

A combination of `effect` a buffer `WritableSignal` would do the trick, but would lead to poor devX I think.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Provide pipe for async signal or enable asyncComputed" (#50183)

Issues.Title: Add hasOnlyError method to AbstractControl for checking a specific error
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

The hasError method in AbstractControl is really helpful for detecting if a validation error exists on a form control. However, sometimes we need to check if a specific validation error is the only error present on the control.

For example, in some cases, we may want to show an error message only when the user has provided an invalid email address, and there are no other errors present on the control (e.g., required, maxlength, etc.).

Therefore, I would like to request adding a hasOnlyError method to AbstractControl that allows checking if a specific error is the only error present on the control.

The method signature could be:

hasOnlyError(errorCode: string | string[]): boolean

Where errorCode is the validation error code (e.g., 'required', 'email', etc.), or an array of codes, and the method returns true if the control has the specified error code(s) and no other errors, otherwise, it returns false.

This feature would make it easier to implement complex validation scenarios and improve the overall flexibility of the Angular Forms API.

Thank you for considering this feature request!

### Proposed solution

hasOnlyError(errorCode: string | string[]): boolean

### Alternatives considered

currently we have to go through this.formGroup.get('formControl')?.errors

I don't have a good alternatives now.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add hasOnlyError method to AbstractControl for checking a specific error" (#50179)

Issues.Title: Angular 15: Interpolation binding throws JIT Compiler exceptions in the console
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? compiler ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description I have a very simple angular widget that fits into an existing HTML page. It has only one component inside which I have a few SELECT fields. Everything worked fine until I decided to use SplitChunks plugin of webpack to split all the node_modules stuff into a separate vendor bundle and include it separately. My application is not using any builder, it was never built using any building tool such as angular-cli. I built it from scratch, wrote my own main.ts, module.ts, and app.component.ts, and wrote my own webpack.config.js. The error I got at runtime was ``` Unhandled Promise rejection: Errors during JIT compilation of template for AppComponent: Sys.ParameterCountException: Sys.ParameterCountException: Parameter count mismatch. ``` I experimented with the problem and tried to isolate it and here are some interesting findings. There were a couple of interpolation bindings like the following ``` {{ firstName }} ``` I changed the above to the following and it started working :) `` I added all sorts of crazy things such as *ngFor, *ngIf, banana-in-the-box bindings [()] and no compiler errors. As soon as there is an interpolation used, it starts to fail in the bootstrap process. What could cause interpolation to fail with Sys.ParameterCountException? Any lead on what should I check, or any pointers would be appreciated. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true (" [ERROR ->]{{firstname}} ) at verifySemanticsOfNgModuleDef (core.mjs:22300:1) at AppModule.get (core.mjs:22248:1) at getInjectorDef (core.mjs:421:1) ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true @angular/compiler: ^15.2.8 @angular/core: ^15.2.8 @angular/common: ^15.2.8 System: OS: Windows 10 10.0.19044 CPU: (16) x64 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1270P Memory: 11.16 GB / 31.69 GB Binaries: Node: 16.17.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE npm: 8.15.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD Browsers: Edge: Spartan (44.19041.1266.0), Chromium (112.0.1722.68) Internet Explorer: 11.0.19041.1202 Packages: css-loader: ^6.7.3 => 6.7.3 style-loader: ^3.3.2 => 3.3.2 ts-loader: ^9.4.2 => 9.4.2 webpack-cli: ^5.0.2 => 5.0.2 ``` ### Anything else? I am trying really hard to reproduce the issue, will share a plunk if I have any. At this time I can answer questions or share snippets on demand from the proprietary application we are having issues with. This is not a true SPA application, this is a "widget" that fits into a larger HTML page with a few extra things around it. In fact, this angular application is a body of a bootstrap popup.

Issues.Title: feat: toSignal accepts Subscribable (in addition to Observable)
Issues.Body:
This PR extends [`toSignal`](https://angular.io/api/core/rxjs-interop/toSignal) to accept any [`Subscribable`](https://rxjs.dev/api/index/interface/Subscribable) (instead of only [`Observable`](https://rxjs.dev/api/index/class/Observable)) for consistency with [`AsyncPipe`](https://angular.io/api/common/AsyncPipe#input-value) and for broader compatibility with any observable library (that is compatible with the `Subscribable` interface).

This is only a type change as the implementation does not use anything else than the `Subscribable` interface anyway.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

`toSignal` only accepts `Observable`.

## What is the new behavior?

`toSignal` accepts any `Subscribable`.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

This PR is similar to [PR 39627](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/39627) that I had opened for `AsyncPipe`.

Issues.Title: NG0912 error after migrating (to 16) multiple components with no selector
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Components generated with the CLI (pre 16.x or 16.x) using `--skip-selector` result in the browser displaying NG0912 error, claiming that multiple of my components have colliding selector `ng-component`, when using Angular 16. This error is **not** present in at least 13, 14, and 15.

The components in question all look like this:
```typescript
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
@Component({
  templateUrl: './foo-with-no-selector.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./foo-with-no-selector.component.scss'],
})
export class FooWithNoSelector{ ... some stuff }
@Component({
  templateUrl: './bar-with-no-selector.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./bar-with-no-selector.component.scss'],
})
export class BarWithNoSelector{ ... some stuff }
```
These components are used only in Routing (or manually created as dialogs using material).
Afaik the convention for route only components was to omit `selector`. Is this change intentional or is it documented somewhere?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
NG0912: Component ID generation collision detected. Components 'FooWithNoSelector' and 'BarWithNoSelector' with selector 'ng-component' generated the same component ID. To fix this, you can change the selector of one of those components or add an extra host attribute to force a different ID. Find more at https://angular.io/errors/NG0912
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.0
Node: 18.16.0
Package Manager: npm 9.6.4
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 16.0.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, material, material-luxon-adapter, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.0
```

Issues.Title: Injector.create to return EnvironmentInjector
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Currently using `Injector.create` returns `Injector` which is actually `R3Injector` which is `EnvironmentInjector`.
To allow destroying this new injector it must be casted to `EnvironmentInjector`. Some cases require it to allow dynamic injectors creation and destruction.

### Proposed solution

Return `EnvironemtInjector` directly to eliminate the casting.

### Alternatives considered

Cast it myself or maybe this is not the desired behavior?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Injector.create to return EnvironmentInjector" (#50157)

Issues.Title: Module not found with relative imports with .js extension in a typescript project
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When I use relative imports with '.js' extension from TypeScript, the module is not found.
`./src/common/Synchronizer.ts:3:0-61 - Error: Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '../inez/repositories/actions.js' in '/home/mag/project/KodeKonveyor/angulartest/src/common`

I converted the code to this style because the unit testing tool I use can work reasonably fast (without bundling) with ESM modules.

I do believe that requiring relative imports with extensions for ESM modules in TypeScript is a bug of the TypeScript compiler, but they treat it as a feature. So here we are.

Convert an import to relative one and add '.js' extension.

Issues.Title: Angular Jest test runner not compatible with test tables (`it.each(...`)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

While trying the experimental Jest test runner (by modifying `angular.json` as detailed in the [blog post](https://blog.angular.io/moving-angular-cli-to-jest-and-web-test-runner-ef85ef69ceca)), to write [Jest test tables](https://jestjs.io/docs/api#testeachtablename-fn-timeout).

First, Typescript complains that `.each` does not exist. This was fixed by installing the types with both npm and alterting `tsconfig.json` (instructions and example below).

However while this removes the compilation error in VSCode, it does not get the tests running. When using `ng test` an exception is raised (see below).

What has to be done to ensure the Angular test runner can use Jest test tables

Install the Jest types:

```shell
$ npm install --save-dev @types/jest
```

Update `tsconfig.json`:

```json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        [...]
        "types": ["jest"]
    }
}
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
NOTE: The Jest builder is currently EXPERIMENTAL and not ready for production use.
The esbuild-based browser application builder ('browser-esbuild') is currently in developer preview and is not yet recommended for production use. For additional information, please see https://angular.io/guide/esbuild
✘ [ERROR] TS2339: Property 'each' does not exist on type '(expectation: string, assertion?: ImplementationCallback | undefined, timeout?: number | undefined) => void'. [plugin angular-compiler]

    src/utils/placeholder.utils.spec.ts:11:11:
      11 │         it.each(testTable)("should return the expected display nam...
         ╵            ~~~~
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

Note: release notes for v1.31.0 were removed, as the change to `DEFAULT_YQ_VERSION` was more breaking than we realized, and not meeting our semver guarantee.
Please do not use that release.

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

1.  Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.31.1")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "5f3443b1d98a462a8b7330f4742483afc8b2d17c8555dd97ce4146f43e961718",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.31.1",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/download/v1.31.1/bazel-lib-v1.31.1.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

Optional toolchains:

```starlark

### Register the following toolchain to use jq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_jq_toolchains")

register_jq_toolchains()

### Register the following toolchain to use yq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_yq_toolchains")

register_yq_toolchains()
```

Issues.Title: fileReplacement for less files
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

I've read multiple threads talking about fileReplacements.  One comment [#16779 comment ](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16779#issuecomment-579183693) stated it was not meant for files outside of bundles.  If I'm not mistaken, styles are part of the bundle.

The problem: I'm using a styles package that I don't have control over.  It has a less variable for setting the base-href path for the assets.  
- When I serve it up at `/`, everything is fine
- When I serve it up at  `/some-path` I have to update this less variable to /some-path/assets

Now I have different configurations when I'm running the app locally and when I'm deploying it at /some-path on a server and angular fileReplacements doesn't support this scenario.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I'd like to be able to replace any file at the src root level for different configurations.  This would allow me to have:

- styles.base.less (all my imports and global styles)
- styles.less (import styles.base.less and modify the less variable)
- styles.local.less (import styles.base.less, no variable modification, use this to replace styles.less in local config)

### Describe alternatives you've considered

- Considered fileReplacement above ^
- Considered putting a file in assets, but I believe .less is a preprocessor on css and it would only copy the file
- Considered webpack.config.js but again it would just copy the file without doing the pre-processing
- Considered running a script right before build.  I'm using nx so none of my nx build commands would work without creating an npm script for each one
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "fileReplacement for less files" (#25152)

Issues.Title: Angular 16 - esbuild - 404 on routes inside proxy.conf.json
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common, core, Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When `angular.json` has `esbuild` enabled (in `architect.build.builder`):
```
"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser-esbuild",
```
The app, running locally, shows `404` in the _Network_ tab of Chrome Developer Tools on API call that is set up in the `proxy.conf.json`

```json
{
  "/authapi/*": {
    "target": "https://stage-api.forbes.com",
    "changeOrigin": true,
    "secure": true
  }
}
```
Locally the app runs on `https://one.forbes.com:4200/`  and my `hosts` file has this entry `127.0.0.1 one.forbes.com`

When running the same code but changing the `builder`:

```
"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
```

Everything works as it did before ✅ (no 404, API call is made)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): convert dev-server glob proxy entries for esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the development server, an underlying Vite server is used. The Vite server currently does not support glob-based entries for the proxy configuration. They must either be prefix strings or regular expressions. The Webpack-based development server, however, does support globs. To remove the need to have different proxy configuration files for the two servers, the entries will now be normalized to regular expressions when using the Vite server. This allows existing proxy configurations to work without modification.

Fixes #25148
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): convert dev-server glob proxy entries for esbuild builder" (#25149)

Issues.Title: Proxy is not working when using esbuild
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When running an application using the esbuild the proxy config is ignored. After changing the builder back to the default, the proxy gets hit. 

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create a new app in Angular 16 using `ng new proxy-test --standalone`
2. Change the builder option in `angular.json` to `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser-esbuild`
3. Add a `proxyConfig` to the serve configuration
4. Run the proxy and the application
5. Endpoints using the defined proxy path are not received in the proxy.

Expected behavior: the proxy configured in the proxy.conf.json should be called when the defined endpoint is called.

Only after changing the builder option back to the default (`@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser`) is the proxy used.

Issues.Title: Expose the internal jest preset to be used for feature libs
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Description

In monorepo (app-shell + feature libs) we need to integrate Jest either by a custom integration or a tooling like NX - therefore this is out of the angular cli scope. Either way, it would make sense to export the `globalSetup` or a complete preset from  `@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/builders/jest'` as this is being used by the experimental Jest implementation already.

Related issue: https://github.com/thymikee/jest-preset-angular/issues/2058

### Describe the solution you'd like

### npm scripts
```
"test": "NODE_OPTIONS=--experimental-vm-modules jest",
```

### jest.config.mjs

```
import { globalSetup } from '@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/builders/jest';

module.exports =
{
	globalSetup
};
```

### current error

Of course this is not possible to import from node modules:
```
Directory import '[...]node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/builders/jest' is not supported resolving ES modules imported from [..]jest.config.mjs
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fix index option const value for browser-esbuild
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The `index` option of the `browser-esbuild` builder is defined to accept one of a `string`, an `object`, or a const `"false"`. Note the const value it's not `false` but a string value. Because of that, there's no way to disable the index generation:

- If we set the option to `"false"` we get an error because it matches both the `string` and the const:
	```
	Error: Schema validation failed with the following errors:
    Data path "/index" must be object.
    Data path "/index" must match exactly one schema in oneOf.
    ```
- If we set the option to `false` we get an error because it doesn't match any of the possible definitions:
	```
	Error: Schema validation failed with the following errors:
    Data path "/index" must be string.
    Data path "/index" must be object.
    Data path "/index" must be equal to constant.
    Data path "/index" must match exactly one schema in oneOf.
    ```
- If we run the build with `ng build --no-index` (as one of the goals of the change https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/0d4a40fd6eea6e60f5fc17ddb4ff74e58086669d) we get the same as the previous error:
    ```
	Error: Schema validation failed with the following errors:
    Data path "/index" must be string.
    Data path "/index" must be object.
    Data path "/index" must be equal to constant.
    Data path "/index" must match exactly one schema in oneOf.
    ```

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

The `index` option of the `browser-esbuild` builder is defined to accept one of a `string`, and `object` or a const `false` (boolean). This allows users to set the option to `false` in their `angular.json` or to run the build with `--no-index`.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fix index option const value for browser-esbuild" (#25145)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support dev-server package prebundling with esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the development server with the esbuild-based browser application builder, the underlying
Vite server will now prebundle packages present in an application. During the prebundling process,
the Angular linker will also be invoked to ensure that APF packages are processed for AOT usage.
The Vite prebundling also provides automatic persistent caching of processed packages. This allows
reuse of processed packages across `ng serve` invocations. To support the use of prebundling at the
development server level, all packages are considered external from the build level. The first time
a package is used within an application there may be a short delay upon accessing the page as the
package is processed. Due to the persistent nature of the prebundling, the `ng cache` command is used
to control the use of the feature. The prebundling is currently the only aspect of the esbuild-based
build system that uses persistent caching.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support dev-server package prebundling with esbuild builder" (#25139)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): workaround for esbuild static block AOT generated code
Issues.Body:
esbuild currently has a defect involving self-referencing a class within a static code block or static field initializer. This is not an issue for projects that use the default browserslist as these elements are an ES2022 feature which is not support by all browsers in the default list. However, if a custom browserslist is used that only has newer browsers than the static code elements may be present. This issue is compounded by the default usage of the tsconfig `"useDefineForClassFields": false` option present in generated CLI projects which causes static code blocks to be used instead of static fields. esbuild currently unconditionally downlevels all static fields in top-level classes so to workaround the Angular issue only static code blocks are disabled here.

Fixes #25127
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): workaround for esbuild static block AOT generated code" (#25132)

Issues.Title: browser-esbuild less-plugin -
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I tested the esbuild and encountered 2 problems on the less compilation:
- in [less-plugin](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/builders/browser-esbuild/stylesheets/less-plugin.ts):
  - we have a stack overflow error with the first attempt to direct loading as a relative path: 
  ```typescript
          // Attempt direct loading as a relative path to avoid resolution overhead
          const directResult = this.loadFileSync(filename, currentDirectory, options, environment);
          // this.loadFileSync => he calls himself
  ```
  - the file resolution doesn't work as expected and all paths configured on `stylePreprocessorOptions` are not used

Just for my tests and to workaround, I just remove the override function `` to use the original less [FileManager](https://github.com/less/less.js/blob/master/packages/less/src/less-node/file-manager.js).

- always in [less-plugin](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/builders/browser-esbuild/stylesheets/less-plugin.ts) the javascriptEnabled options is not enabled so we've got some errors

To workaround this I added the options javascriptEnabled to less.render:
```typescript
less.render(data, {
      filename,
      paths: options.includePaths,
      plugins: [resolverPlugin],
      rewriteUrls: 'all',
      javascriptEnabled: true,
      sourceMap: options.sourcemap
        ? {
            sourceMapFileInline: true,
            outputSourceFiles: true,
          }
        : undefined,
    } as Less.Options);
```

### Minimal Reproduction

- Just create a new project with "inlineStyleLanguage" in less
- Add external dependecy: `ng-zorro-antd@15.1.0`
- Import antd default theme: `@import (multiple) 'ng-zorro-antd/src/style/themes/dark';`
- Preprocessor options in angular.json : 
`
"stylePreprocessorOptions": {
  "includePaths": [
    "node_modules"
  ]
},
`

Issues.Title: bug(Chips): Screen reader does not announce proper selected state when multiselect enabled
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using Chips component that allows multiple options to be selected, screen reader does not announce the state correctly and causes confusion for customers. Without `multiple` attribute screen reader announces the "selected/not selected" state as expected.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open basic example from the Chips doc:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10143921/236651172-75b9d303-f1ca-4fe8-90c7-2d975d14d0af.png)

2. Add `multiple` attribute to `mat-chip-listbox` to allow multiselect.
```
<mat-chip-listbox multiple aria-label="Fish selection">
  <mat-chip-option>One fish</mat-chip-option>
  <mat-chip-option>Two fish</mat-chip-option>
  <mat-chip-option color="accent" selected>Accent fish</mat-chip-option>
  <mat-chip-option color="warn">Warn fish</mat-chip-option>
</mat-chip-listbox>
```

3. Turn on a screen reader and navigate between chip options.

### Expected Behavior

When multiselect enabled, when clicking/tabing on a chip, screen reader announces:

- (when option selected) "{label} selected"
- (when option not selected) "{label} not selected"

### Actual Behavior

When multiselect enabled, when clicking/tabing on a chip, screen reader announces:

On MacOS + VoiceOver:
- (when option selected) "{label} selected, selected"
- (when option not selected) "{label} not selected, selected"

On Linux + Orca:
- (when option selected) "{label}"
- (when option not selected) "{label} not selected"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10143921/236651100-b67ed0d2-d84e-47d9-9df3-387fabefb302.png)

### Environment

Not a custom env, able to reproduce in basic example on StackBlitz in Chrome:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10143921/236651165-6bb42b01-1e5a-4638-b893-a23c3542ed59.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Chips): Screen reader does not announce proper selected state when multiselect enabled" (#27053)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTable): Jumpy MatPager when inside expandable MatTable
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

With your [examples section](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples), there are demos for using expandable `MatTable`, with the help of `ngTemplateOutlet`, and there are demos for using `MatPager`. But there isn't a single example of using both. And if there were, you would see that when combining expandable `MatTable` with `MatPager`, it no longer looks well.

What happens - every time we expand a panel, all panels that are below + the pager show an animation artifact whereby the whole thing jumps lower first, and then it jumps back up, which doesn't look well. Just as we remove `MatPager` from expandable `MatTable`, that artifact disappears.

### Reproduction

Take any of the [existing examples](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples) of expandable `MatTable` (with template), and add `MatPager` into such demo, you will get the undesired effect of jumpy animation upon expansion.


### Expected Behavior

When adding `MatPager` into expandable `MatTable`, the latter must continue animating as before.

### Actual Behavior

Once `MatPager` is added into expandable `MatTable`, expansion of any item results in a jump of all items below + the pager.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.9
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9
- Browser(s): Chrome 112
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTable): Jumpy MatPager when inside expandable MatTable" (#27052)

Issues.Title: feat(checkbox, radio): Provide a way to vertically align checkboxes and radios in stacked layouts
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

MDC increased checkbox and radio touch areas. It means that in a stacked layout, the checkboxes/radios are visually indented to the right.
It can be seen in the checkbox docs: https://material.angular.io/components/checkbox/examples (the "Checkboxes with reactive forms" example).

It makes forms visually unbalanced - because other elements (labels, text inputs) don't have such indentation.

While a workaround with custom CSS is possible, it would relies on internal details of the Material components (sizes).

It would be great to have the official / documented way to do that. Maybe expose a variable as public API, add an Input to the components, or something else.

### Use Case

_No response_

Issues.Title: ng update @angular/material@15 forget about updating angular.json prebuilt-themes path to legacy
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The `ng update @angular/material@15` command update every `@angular/material` import path in order to use the legacy classes. This behaviour prevents breaking the project using that command during a migration from v14 to v15.
Sadly the script forget about updating the `prebuilt-themes` path under the `angular.json` file in the `styles` section.

### Minimal Reproduction

- Starting with a basic project using @angular/core @angular/cli and @angular/material in version 14.
- Be aware to have a prebuild-themes imported inside the `angular.json` file under the `styles` sections. 
```
// angular.json
...
"styles": [
  "./node_modules/@angular/material/prebuilt-themes/deeppurple-amber.css",
  "src/styles.css"
],
...
```
- Run `ng update @angular/core@15 @angular/cli@15` to update core and cli to v15
- Add and commit changes
- Run `ng update/material@15` to update material to v15

Every material classes import paths are automatically updated to use the legacy version
example: 
`import { MatDialogRef } from '@angular/material/dialog';`
is now

Issues.Title: bug(Datepicker): accessibility screen reader arrow key movement not in sync visually on calendar
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12

### Description

When using a keyboard while running a screen reader such as NVDA or JAWS, the highlighted day doesn't change visually like it used to in v12 and below. JAWS seems to compensate by putting a green square but in NVDA the cursor doesn't move visually. Logically, focus does move as screen reader user can hear where they've moved to. 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. launch a screen reader such as JAWS or NVDA
2. go to http://material.angular.io and navigate to the Datepicker component
3. tab to the "Basic datepicker" field's calendar icon and hit ENTER to launch it
4. use keyboard arrow keys to move around and notice if focus moves around visually
5. change Angular Material version at top right of screen to an older version and repeat steps 3 and 4 to see the difference, if any


### Expected Behavior

Should see little circle moving from day to day

### Actual Behavior

No movement of little circle

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material: 13 plus
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Datepicker): accessibility screen reader arrow key movement not in sync visually on calendar" (#27032)

Issues.Title: fix(material/tabs): avoid unnecessary updates of tab ink bar
Issues.Body:
There's a resize observer in the `paginated-tab-header`, that calls `_alignInkBarToSelectedTab` method here https://github.com/angular/components/blob/946cc6743c4d0f46c943fca7fdb2ed07148535d9/src/material/tabs/paginated-tab-header.ts#L206 

This causes the ink bar to be updated each time there's any size change. Sometimes it can cause additional problems. For example, in our case we are slightly customizing the UI so that selected tab has larger font weight than others. And this actually triggers the resize observer, which attempts to redraw the ink bar twice and breaks the ink bar animation

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33101123/236193271-2e37a5c6-a267-4846-b680-554e944c554c.mp4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/tabs): avoid unnecessary updates of tab ink bar" (#27031)

Issues.Title: Mat-Select is not functioning properly after angular and material version upgrade from v10 to v15.2.4
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Angular V10.1.5 and Material V10.2.4

### Description

This report is regarding dropdown field issue of Angular Material V15.2.4 (Mat-Select)

Recently, we have upgraded our project's angular version from v10.1.5 to v15.2.4.
Application's drop down fields were working fine in angular v10.1.5 and material v10.2.4.
But when the version got upgraded with angular v15.2.4 and material v15.2.4., all the drop down fields are facing issue in showing the selected option.

**Issue**:

- There is no issue in listing the options.
- After selecting any one of the option, mat-select has to show up the selected option.
- But the field is blank after selecting an option.

**Support Needed**

- Angular support team to provide a solution to fix the issue in Mat-Select drop down.
- To provide if any code changes or import level changes has to be done.
- We have tested with angular v15.2.4 and material version as v12.2.13, all seems fine.
- Is it fine to have a downgraded material version with higher angular version?.

**Kindly respond whether it is a good standard to have Angular v15.2.4 and material v12.2.13 as part of production release or provide an fix for the issue in the upgraded versions for both angular and material v15.2.4.**

**Below one is the actual issue**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62600471/236112469-d94af7e5-060a-41b9-ae2d-72f97ca8b6cb.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

1. Set the angular version as 15.2.4 and material version as 15.2.4
2. Inject a Mat-Select drop down field in template
3. Set a list of options in .ts file for Mat-options (Example - Apple, Orange, Mango etc)
4. Options will be binding correctly in the selectable drop down.
5. Select any one of the values from the drop down list.
**Issue - After selecting, selected value will not show up in the field.**

### Expected Behavior

The expected behavior is - After selecting any one of the option, mat-select has to show up the selected option.

Expected working one as mentioned in this example - https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples#select-form

### Actual Behavior

Actual behavior - After selecting an option, selected value does not show up in the Mat-Select Field.

Below one the case where the field is empty after selecting an option.
**This is the broken drop down issue**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62600471/236112602-5cc10da8-de42-489a-a392-1754351d23f4.png)


### Environment

- Angular: **v15.2.4**
- CDK/Material: **CDK - v15.2.4 and Material - v15.2.4**
- Browser(s): **Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge**
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): **Windows**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Select is not functioning properly after angular and material version upgrade from v10 to v15.2.4" (#27026)

Issues.Title: fix(material/badge): insert inline description for non-interactive hosts
Issues.Body:
The badge current applies `aria-describedby` to surface the developer-provided description. However, assistive technology generally doesn't read these description on non-interactive elements. So, we can take advantage of our handy `InteractivityChecker` and do something different if the host is not focusable; we add the description inline as the next sibling with `.cdk-visually-hidden`.

Fixes #26190
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/badge): insert inline description for non-interactive hosts" (#27025)
